alert.note: Alert for Nez Perce (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 05 at 3:05PM MDT until June 05 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: The National Weather Service in Spokane has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... The Bedrock Burn Scar in... Northeastern Nez Perce County in north central Idaho... * Until 500 PM PDT. * At 205 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain over the Bedrock Burn Scar. Radar estimates between 0.2 and 0.4 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms in and around the Bedrock Burn Scar. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of areas in and around the Bedrock Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lenore. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: The affected areas are in and below the Bedrock burn scar north of Lenore, including parts of Bedrock Road and River Road. Some drainage basins impacted include Bedrock Creek, Louse Creek and Pine Creek. High intensity rainfall on the burned area may cause flash flooding, mud slides and rock slides. Hikers, residents, and motorists in and below the Bedrock burned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. This is a life threatening situation. Heavy rainfall will cause extensive and severe flash flooding of creeks...streams...and ditches in the Bedrock burn scar. Severe debris flows can also be anticipated across roads. Roads and driveways may be washed away in places. If you encounter flood waters...climb to safety. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life.
